text: where are these port changes? i also have 30303 and 30304 and 5000 used
also, why did you leave github?

Hello, I would like to test a new chaincode in debug mode by using eclipse, but when I start my chaincode I have the following error: 'shim CRIT: peer address not configured, can't connect to peer. So it's normal because I haven't configured this address, but I don't know where is the configuration file. thank you for your help.
<@U1Z6V101X>:  the easiest thing is to pass `CORE_PEER_ADDRESS` as an environment variable when you start the chaincode
ok thanks I will try this:  os.Setenv("CORE_PEER_ADDRESS", "127.0.0.1:5000")

Hi there, 
Do you know how/where to fetch information about the network of peers (it's running locally in Vagrant) to put them in a user-friendly dashboard? 
For example : number of peers, number of transactions or blocks, number of  invoke / query etc.

The goal here is to bring more visibility on the blockchain side of a project through a dedicated interface, to show people how it works backstage. 
Thank you very much
FYI: on holiday this week, availability spotty until I return 8/15

<@U1JB7QCBD>: <@U1RJ0M1EC> the patch that affected the port assignments was merged last week. An announcement posted here and on the <mailto:hyperledger-fabric@lists.hyperledger.org|hyperledger-fabric@lists.hyperledger.org> mailing list

<@U1HG09QB1> you could fetch a lot of that info from the REST API: <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/f7d932108d1e339d3371b6e8e922d09ecf913e9a/docs/API/CoreAPI.md#rest-api>

I've also seen a nice-looking "Hyperledger Explorer" dashboard floating around, can't find the code though: <https://vimeo.com/174814785> <@U1E02KGPM> may be able to link to the code for the Explorer

attachments.title: hyperledger/fabric
attachments.text: Read-only historic repo. Current development is at <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/admin/projects/fabric> . pull requests not accepted

attachments.title: Hyperledger Explorer Demonstration
attachments.text: A demo of the Hyperledger Explorer, displaying block, transaction and network information that are retrieved from the blockchain using gRPC REST APIs. Developed using AngularJS, HTML, CSS, javascript, jQuery and d3.js.
attachments.video_html: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/174814785?autoplay=1" width="400" height="225" frameborder="0" title="Hyperledger Explorer Demonstration" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe>

text: <@U1HG09QB1> Hyperledger explorer can be found at <https://github.com/xspeedcruiser/fabric/tree/explorer/peer/Explorer>

attachments.title: xspeedcruiser/fabric
attachments.text: fabric - Fabric is a blockchain project in Incubation proposed to the community and documented at <https://goo.gl/RYQZ5N>. Information on what Incubation entails can be found in the Hyperledger Proj...
